intro: Hedyotis matthewii, commonly known as the Matthew's spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or rocky habitats. It has a compact growth habit and produces tiny, clustered inflorescences. Hedyotis matthewii is often found in montane regions and is adapted to humid, temperate climates.
